alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Lake County Above 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued March 10 at 1:54PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE COLORADO AVALANCHE INFORMATION CENTER. …AVALANCHE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4:30 PM FRIDAY MARCH 10 UNTIL 11 AM SUNDAY MARCH 12… *WHAT… The Avalanche Danger will rise to HIGH (Level 4 of 5) on Friday night and stay elevated through through Sunday. *WHERE… Elk Mountains, West Elk Mountains, Ruby Range, and Sawatch Range *WHEN… In effect from 4:30 PM Friday, March 10 until 11 PM on Sunday, March 12 *IMPACTS… Heavy snow and strong winds have created dangerous avalanche conditions in the backcountry. Large and dangerous avalanches will be very easy to trigger. Avalanches will run naturally. *PRECAUTION/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS… Travel in backcountry avalanche terrain is not recommended Friday night through Sunday. Avoid travel on and under slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. You can find more detailed information at colorado.gov/avalanche Cooperstein
